headline.main: A Smoking Ban in City's Jails Worries Correction Officers

docs.abstract: Antismoking legislation scheduled to go into effect in New York City in March will be applied to jails as well as bars and restaurants, and is cause for concern to correction officers; guards fear removing smoking from already tense environment could cause trouble (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Some inmates in New York City's jails will soon face an additional punishment: no smoking. Starting in March, the antismoking legislation signed last Monday by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg will go into effect. It will be applied to jails as well as most bars, restaurants and city-owned buildings, city officials said Thursday.
